page.title: 10BANK FARM IN TUDELEY
page.content: BANK FARM IS RENTED BY MR. VEALL, ONE OF OUR SCHOOL GOVERNORS, FROM THE HADLOW ESTATE. IT IS NOW RUN BY HIS SON BERNARD. BANK FARM COMPRISES 180 ACRES AND GROWS MOSTLY WHEAT, BARLEY, HAY AND BRAMLEY APPLES. IT USED TO BE THREE DIFFERENT FARMS - BANK FARM, LILLEY FARM AND CHURCH FARM. BANK FARM HAS BEEN WORKED BY THE VEALL FAMILY SINCE 1941. THE FARMHOUSE IS OVER 400 YEARS OLD, TWO NEARBY FARM COTTAGES WERE BUILT JUST AFTER THE SECOND WORLD WAR. THE RAILWAY FROM TONBRIDGE TO FOLKESTONE CUTS ACROSS BANK FARM LAND. A PRIZE HERD OF RED SUSSEX CATTLE USED TO BE KEPT AT BANK FARM BUT NOW SCOTTISH MASHAM SHEEP ARE REARED WHICH ARE EXPORTED TO FRANCE FOR MEAT. A PROFITABLE SIDELINE AT BANK FARM IS THE AGRICULTURAL CONTRACT WORK FOR OTHER FARMERS SUCH AS HEDGE CUTTING AND SPRAYING.
